name: Sachse Muslim Society
mission: Sachse Muslim Society (SMS) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that was established in 2014. We are dedicated to religious education and community service. SMS serves Sachse, Wylie, Rowlett, North Garland, Rockwall, and Murphy communities.
theoryOfChange: By providing structured Quranic education and a physical masjid space, the organization aims to revive hearts and nurture the spiritual and intellectual growth of the next generation of Muslims.
zakatClaimEvidence: Found 'zakat al-fitr' on https://sachsemasjid.org/ (https://sachsemasjid.org/); Website mission/programs mention zakat (Source: https://sachsemasjid.org/donate/)

all_citations.claim: The organization operates the Sachse Quran Academy (SQA) featuring Full Time Hifdh and Part Time Hifz programs.
The organization accepts donations and is identified as Zakat-eligible.
In 2023, the organization reported total revenue of $2,799,757, a program expense ratio of 13.6%, working capital of 63.0 months, and fundraising efficiency of $0.11 per $1 raised.
The organization's profile contains financial data but lacks a formal star rating or extensive third-party impact verification.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The score reflects a balance between the organization's strong financial liquidity and its specialized religious focus, tempered by a low program expense ratio and limited data transparency.
areas_for_improvement: The program expense ratio of 13.6% is relatively low, suggesting a high proportion of funds may be directed toward administrative or capital costs rather than direct programming [4].
Limited public documentation regarding third-party impact verification or detailed outcome metrics [5].

dimension_explanations.alignment: The charity shows high donor fit for those seeking Zakat-eligible religious causes, though the overall alignment score is moderated by the specific nature of its cultural and religious urgency [2][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization provides direct religious services through the Sachse Quran Academy, though its impact score is limited by a program expense ratio of 13.6% and a lack of external performance evaluations [1][4][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Sachse Muslim Society is a community-focused religious organization dedicated to Quranic education and spiritual service in the Sachse area.
strengths: Maintains a robust working capital of 63.0 months, indicating high long-term financial stability [4].
High fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.11 per $1 raised [4].
Direct provision of specialized religious services including intensive Quranic memorization programs [1].
baseline_narrative.summary: founded in 2014, the Sachse Muslim Society operates the Sachse Quran Academy, providing specialized religious education through its Full Time Hifdh and Part Time Hifz programs [1]. The organization is recognized as Zakat-eligible and maintains a significant financial reserve to support its community service mission [2][4].

credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity should <cite id="15">expand its board size</cite> and publish independent audited financial statements.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for local donors in the North Texas area who want to invest in the long-term growth of Islamic educational infrastructure and value high financial stability.
donor_motivations: Want to support local Hifdh and Quranic education programs
Prefer organizations with significant financial reserves and low debt risk
Seek to fulfill zakat through religious community development
Value efficient fundraising and low overhead in donor acquisition
giving_considerations: A significant portion of donations may be held in reserve rather than spent immediately
Impact metrics are currently focused on program availability rather than student outcomes
The organization is in a high-growth phase with evolving governance
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors who prioritize high immediate program spending ratios or those seeking rigorous third-party impact evaluations.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects a <cite id="13">documented theory of change</cite> but a lack of <cite id="14">verified outcome data</cite> or external evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The organization uses religious education and community services to foster spiritual growth and community cohesion in the Sachse area.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that educational programs are effectively producing the intended spiritual and community outcomes.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Despite high reserves, the <cite id="11">$4.2M in liabilities</cite> and rapid community growth suggest a high need for continued capital.

strengths.detail: The organization maintains <cite id="4">63.0 months of working capital</cite>, providing an extraordinary level of long-term stability and protection against economic volatility.
SMS operates with high efficiency in its donor acquisition, spending only <cite id="7">$0.11 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions.
The society provides <cite id="2">intensive Quranic memorization (Hifdh)</cite> and Sunday school programs that serve a specific niche in the local Muslim community.

strengths_deep_dive: The Sachse Muslim Society has demonstrated explosive financial growth, evidenced by a <cite id="10">3-year revenue CAGR of 290.8%</cite>. This rapid scaling is supported by a solid asset base, with <cite id="11">total assets reaching $8,345,604</cite> by the end of 2023. Unlike many smaller religious centers, SMS has successfully secured institutional support, including a <cite id="12">$50,000 grant from United Mission For Relief & Development</cite> and funding from the Texas Instruments Foundation. This diversified support suggests a high level of local trust and a <cite id="13">documented theory of change</cite> that resonates with both individual donors and grantmaking bodies.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 2014, the Sachse Muslim Society (SMS) serves as a vital religious and educational hub for the Muslim community in <cite id="1">Sachse, Wylie, Rowlett, and North Garland</cite>. The organization primarily operates the Sachse Quran Academy, which offers specialized curricula including <cite id="2">Full Time Hifdh and Part Time Hifz programs</cite> focused on Quranic memorization. In the 2023 fiscal year, the society reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $2,799,757</cite>, marking a period of significant financial growth. While the organization maintains a <cite id="4">strong working capital of 63.0 months</cite>, its current operational model allocates <cite id="5">13.6% of expenses to programs</cite>, a figure that is notably lower than the <cite id="6">89.8% peer program ratio median</cite> for humanitarian and religious organizations. Despite this, the society demonstrates high fiscal discipline in its development efforts, maintaining a <cite id="7">fundraising efficiency of $0.11 per $1 raised</cite>. As a <cite id="8">zakat-eligible institution</cite>, SMS provides a local avenue for donors to fulfill their religious obligations through support of <cite id="9">fi sabilillah (in the way of Allah)</cite> initiatives, specifically targeting religious education and community infrastructure in the North Texas region.
